hypothesis_content.title: High-Fee Stress Reversion in Layer-1 vs. Layer-2 Arb
hypothesis_content.statement: When median Ethereum transaction fees spike above 150 gwei (90th percentile), creating a stress event, capital will temporarily flow to high-throughput L1s (SOL, AVAX), causing them to outperform ETH by 4%+ over the next 36 hours, before mean-reverting.
hypothesis_content.rationale: High Ethereum fees create usability stress, prompting short-term capital flight to competing Layer-1 chains. This is a tactical, mean-reverting flow, not a secular trend. The trade captures the initial surge before congestion eases or narratives shift.
entry_conditions: ETH median tx fee (7d MA) > 150 gwei
Enter on the L1 (SOL or AVAX) with the lower 4h RSI relative to its own 20-day average

exit_conditions.take_profit: L1/ETH pair hits +6% OR ETH fees drop below 100 gwei

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The selected L1 fails to outperform ETH more than 50% of the time when the fee stress condition is met, indicating the narrative or market structure has broken down.
